channel.title: What makes you a bad person?
channel.description:
Not all bad people are in jail, and not all people in jail are bad. So, what defines a bad person? Of course we have the degree of murder for the sake of killing someone, but where do you draw the line of good and bad?
There are a number of individuals that believe marijuana and other drugs render you in the category of negative individuals, but what if it were for the sake of experimentation? You only live one life, what's wrong with trying as much as you possibly can within the small time span we're given?
There are others that believe steeling opens the door to greed and deficient morals. But what if it were to continue your family's health? What about the whole man, the family and the bread story? If one were to steel bread in order to save his or her family, is it still considered bad?
There are a number of construed reasons for pending someone to a "bad" list, but among what judgment is someone aloud to pass this test? What do you feel defines a bad person?
Discuss.

item.title: What makes you a bad person?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“The Reaper X, post:36, topic:330832”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=427205.msg3138597#msg3138597 date=1267288929]
You spelled steal wrong in your second paragraph.

ZERO - Not all bad people are in jail, and not all people in jail are bad. So, what defines a bad person? Of course we have the degree of murder for the sake of killing someone, but where do you draw the line of good and bad?

ONE - There are a number of individuals that believe marijuana and other drugs render you in the category of negative individuals, but what if it were for the sake of experimentation? You only live one life, what’s wrong with trying as much as you possibly can within the small time span we’re given?

TWO - There are others that believe steeling opens the door to greed and deficient morals. But what if it were to continue your family’s health? What about the whole man, the family and the bread story? If one were to steel bread in order to save his or her family, is it still considered bad?

THREE - There are a number of construed reasons for pending someone to a “bad” list, but among what judgment is someone aloud to pass this test? What do you feel defines a bad person?

Discuss.

[/quote]Irritated you that bad?[/quote]
Not really

Just wanted to point it out.

Read full topic
item.source: What makes you a bad person?

item.title: What makes you a bad person?
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:27, topic:330832”]You spelled steal wrong in your second paragraph.

[quote author=The Reaper X link=topic=427205.msg3137257#msg3137257 date=1267135109]
ZERO - Not all bad people are in jail, and not all people in jail are bad. So, what defines a bad person? Of course we have the degree of murder for the sake of killing someone, but where do you draw the line of good and bad?

ONE - There are a number of individuals that believe marijuana and other drugs render you in the category of negative individuals, but what if it were for the sake of experimentation? You only live one life, what’s wrong with trying as much as you possibly can within the small time span we’re given?

TWO - There are others that believe steeling opens the door to greed and deficient morals. But what if it were to continue your family’s health? What about the whole man, the family and the bread story? If one were to steel bread in order to save his or her family, is it still considered bad?

THREE - There are a number of construed reasons for pending someone to a “bad” list, but among what judgment is someone aloud to pass this test? What do you feel defines a bad person?

Discuss.
[/quote][/quote]Irritated you that bad?

[quote=“krackkid, post:24, topic:330832”]Who the hell cares what the bible says?, its a book, I can go off and make a book name it the bible, will you people follow everything in it?[/quote]People know the name because of what’s inside of it, they don’t know what’s inside of it because of the name.

[quote=“jme, post:32, topic:330832”]And even if society views something as good, it can ultimately have bad consequences.[/quote]True, our definition is rather a mesh of lines overlapping each other.

Read full topic

item.title: What makes you a bad person?
item.dc:creator: @The_Chubby_Bunny The Chubby Bunny
item.description:
@The_Chubby_Bunny wrote:

krackkid:

Who the hell cares what the bible says?, its a book, I can go off and make a book name it the bible, will you people follow everything in it?

No, you’d write it, name it the bible, then people would be like, “Oh, heres a bible, I’ll buy it because I am interested in the content within.” Then they’d read it and say, “Hey, whats this? No bible, you ridda wrong book, gai.”

Name it something else, like The Bible 2.

Read full topic

item.title: What makes you a bad person?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“krackkid, post:28, topic:330832”][quote author=Jc22493 link=topic=427205.msg3138551#msg3138551 date=1267284142]

Who the hell cares what the bible says?, its a book, I can go off and make a book name it the bible, will you people follow everything in it?

You’re not influential in any way, so no.
[/quote]
It was a joke…Well kinda…[/quote]

Really all that would need to happen for that is a couple followers to start, then it would grow. Dont hate me, but im gonna use Charles Manson for an example. He got into many peoples heads because of stuff he said to them.

NOTE THIS IS JUST AN EXAMPLE, but i do know this is the method he used, not 100%, but a close to one he used in the 70’s because of all the drugs around.

Girl - runs around frantic she just got kicked out of her house
Charles - Stops her and says “Really? Those damn people just don’t like you do they? Come hang out with me and the others who were treated the same way”
Girl - Because she is lost and confused, she follows him in hopes of help.

Its just catching people at the right moment in time that influences them the most. Sure, today, we have the brains to go to one of our friend’s house and see if we can stay there for a short while, until we can make it on our own. Some do get easily influenced by others when they are lost/confused.

I know i could have used allot better of an example, but it was the only thing i could think of.

Read full topic
item.source: What makes you a bad person?

item.title: What makes you a bad person?
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

I believe the name for you topics would be Ethics. Which is defined as…
Ethics (also known as moral philosophy) is a branch of philosophy which seeks to address questions about morality; that is, about concepts such as good and bad, right and wrong, justice, and virtue.
Everyone has different ethical values, but most people who question these also question beyond laws of basic religion, as in do not question your all-mighty being(s).

Read full topic
item.source: What makes you a bad person?

item.title: What makes you a bad person?
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“The Soul, post:18, topic:330832”]To me it depends on what the person did and for what cause. Say, for example, someone takes someone’s money for personal gain; they would be defined as a bad person.

[quote author=The Reaper X link=topic=427205.msg3138245#msg3138245 date=1267244714]

[quote author=Niall link=topic=427205.msg3138236#msg3138236 date=1267244166]

When a child is is born and in the growing stages of life, they lie, steal, fight and so on

Bad parenting.
[/quote]Though, what if one were born and raised by society? Not literally, but theoretically. trading homeless shelters nonstop making it impossible to establish a true moral foundation from a “parent” figure. At the age of 18, after all those years without prior parents but rather society and experiences to form what he or she knows is right from wrong, how would you say they should perform?

There is nothing wrong with homosexual.
[/quote]The Bible is a mass production of ethic and moral value. Laws hold the same thing, but have mortal consequence such as jail and public service rather than consequence after life. Homosexuality is considered “illegal” whilst abiding by the Bible, while murdering someone is illegal whilst abiding by the law. How do you determine which is bad when the two can be made so similar.

I myself don’t believe that homosexuals themselves are classed as bad people however what they’re doing is wrong. My view of the subject is that the choice to follow the homosexual lifestyle is completely willingly on behalf of the person.[/quote]I agree with the idea of personal gain. Anything done illegally or what anyone would see as universally bad (eg. breaking a law) for personal gain is wrong. And I don’t have any negative view on homosexuals, I’m just pointing out some things that I know most users aren’t taking into account ;).

Read full topic
item.source: What makes you a bad person?

item.title: What makes you a bad person?
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

To me it depends on what the person did and for what cause. Say, for example, someone takes someone’s money for personal gain; they would be defined as a bad person.

[quote=“The Reaper X, post:17, topic:330832”][quote author=Niall link=topic=427205.msg3138236#msg3138236 date=1267244166]

When a child is is born and in the growing stages of life, they lie, steal, fight and so on

Bad parenting.
[/quote]Though, what if one were born and raised by society? Not literally, but theoretically. trading homeless shelters nonstop making it impossible to establish a true moral foundation from a “parent” figure. At the age of 18, after all those years without prior parents but rather society and experiences to form what he or she knows is right from wrong, how would you say they should perform?

[quote author=krackkid link=topic=427205.msg3138241#msg3138241 date=1267244314]
There is nothing wrong with homosexual.
[/quote]The Bible is a mass production of ethic and moral value. Laws hold the same thing, but have mortal consequence such as jail and public service rather than consequence after life. Homosexuality is considered “illegal” whilst abiding by the Bible, while murdering someone is illegal whilst abiding by the law. How do you determine which is bad when the two can be made so similar.[/quote]

I myself don’t believe that homosexuals themselves are classed as bad people however what they’re doing is wrong. My view of the subject is that the choice to follow the homosexual lifestyle is completely willingly on behalf of the person.

Read full topic
item.source: What makes you a bad person?

Bad parenting.[/quote]Though, what if one were born and raised by society? Not literally, but theoretically. trading homeless shelters nonstop making it impossible to establish a true moral foundation from a “parent” figure. At the age of 18, after all those years without prior parents but rather society and experiences to form what he or she knows is right from wrong, how would you say they should perform?

[quote=“krackkid, post:16, topic:330832”]There is nothing wrong with homosexual.[/quote]The Bible is a mass production of ethic and moral value. Laws hold the same thing, but have mortal consequence such as jail and public service rather than consequence after life. Homosexuality is considered “illegal” whilst abiding by the Bible, while murdering someone is illegal whilst abiding by the law. How do you determine which is bad when the two can be made so similar.

item.title: What makes you a bad person?
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“Old Rsc Player, post:12, topic:330832”]I got a better questions, are kids born “bad” or born “good”.

When a child is is born and in the growing stages of life, they lie, steal, fight and so on, parents constantly have to tell there kids “right” from “wrong”. So are kids born bad or good?[/quote]The Hobbes and Locke debate. Hobbes perceived humanity as generally “evil” or bad. Locke viewed humanity more optimistically, commending them on how they were born with a genuinely kind personality.

In my opinion, humanity is brought onto this earth with a clean slate. As you’ve said:

[quote=“Old Rsc Player, post:12, topic:330832”]parents constantly have to tell there kids “right” from “wrong”.[/quote]You’re taught by not just your parents, but society as a whole what is right from wrong. You make the decision as to what choices you make that follow these guidelines established.

Read full topic
item.source: What makes you a bad person?
